00033 //========================================================================
00034 //
00035 //  "Mersenne Twister pseudorandom number generator" 
00036 //  Original Code written by Takuji Nishimura and Makoto Matsumoto
00037 //
00038 //========================================================================

00047 #include "GameCodeStd.h"
00048 #include <time.h>
00049 #include "CMath.h"

00056 
00057 CRandom::CRandom(void)
00058 {
00059         rseed = 1;
00060         // safe0 start
00061         rseed_sp = 0;
00062         mti=CMATH_N+1;
00063         // safe0 end
00064 }       
00065         
00066 // Returns a number from 0 to n (excluding n)
00067 unsigned int CRandom::Random( unsigned int n )
00068 {
00069     unsigned long y;
00070     static unsigned long mag01[2]={0x0, CMATH_MATRIX_A};
00071 
00072         if(n==0)
00073                 return(0);
00074 
00075     /* mag01[x] = x * MATRIX_A  for x=0,1 */
00076 
00077     if (mti >= CMATH_N) { /* generate N words at one time */
00078         int kk;
00079 
00080         if (mti == CMATH_N+1)   /* if sgenrand() has not been called, */
00081             SetRandomSeed(4357); /* a default initial seed is used   */
00082 
00083         for (kk=0;kk<CMATH_N-CMATH_M;kk++) {
00084             y = (mt[kk]&CMATH_UPPER_MASK)|(mt[kk+1]&CMATH_LOWER_MASK);
00085             mt[kk] = mt[kk+CMATH_M] ^ (y >> 1) ^ mag01[y & 0x1];
00086         }
00087         for (;kk<CMATH_N-1;kk++) {
00088             y = (mt[kk]&CMATH_UPPER_MASK)|(mt[kk+1]&CMATH_LOWER_MASK);
00089             mt[kk] = mt[kk+(CMATH_M-CMATH_N)] ^ (y >> 1) ^ mag01[y & 0x1];
00090         }
00091         y = (mt[CMATH_N-1]&CMATH_UPPER_MASK)|(mt[0]&CMATH_LOWER_MASK);
00092         mt[CMATH_N-1] = mt[CMATH_M-1] ^ (y >> 1) ^ mag01[y & 0x1];
00093 
00094         mti = 0;
00095     }
00096   
00097     y = mt[mti++];
00098     y ^= CMATH_TEMPERING_SHIFT_U(y);
00099     y ^= CMATH_TEMPERING_SHIFT_S(y) & CMATH_TEMPERING_MASK_B;
00100     y ^= CMATH_TEMPERING_SHIFT_T(y) & CMATH_TEMPERING_MASK_C;
00101     y ^= CMATH_TEMPERING_SHIFT_L(y);
00102 
00103         // ET - old engine added one to the result.
00104         // We almost NEVER wanted to use this function
00105         // like this.  So, removed the +1 to return a 
00106         // range from 0 to n (not including n).
00107     return (y%n);
00108 }
00109 
00110 
00111 
00112 // Returns a random float between 0.0f-1.0f
00113 // NEW for Game Code Complete 2nd Edition!
00114 
00115 float CRandom::Random( )
00116 {
00117         int r = (float)Random(0xffffffff);
00118         float divisor = (float)0xffffffff;
00119         return (r / divisor) + 0.5f;
00120 }
00121 
00122 
00123 
00124 void CRandom::SetRandomSeed(unsigned int n)
00125 {
00126         /* setting initial seeds to mt[N] using         */
00127         /* the generator Line 25 of Table 1 in          */
00128         /* [KNUTH 1981, The Art of Computer Programming */
00129         /*    Vol. 2 (2nd Ed.), pp102]                  */
00130         mt[0]= n & 0xffffffff;
00131         for (mti=1; mti<CMATH_N; mti++)
00132                 mt[mti] = (69069 * mt[mti-1]) & 0xffffffff;
00133 
00134         rseed = n;
00135 }
00136 
00137 unsigned int CRandom::GetRandomSeed(void)
00138 {
00139         return(rseed);
00140 }
00141 
00142 void CRandom::Randomize(void)
00143 {
00144         SetRandomSeed((unsigned int)time(NULL));
00145 }
